a6_VEPSHpJM.title: How to become a recipient of God's Love | Sai's Kasturi
a6_VEPSHpJM.description:
Examine any devotee's life and it seems to be filled with difficulties. On the face of it, I would love to trade places with Prof. Kasturi, Swami's chiselled child and biographer. But would I really want that after seeing details in his life? 

Why does the devotee 'suffer'? Is there a reason for this? The answer lies in the interesting observation that the devotee rarely complains! Here are some beautiful incidents from the life of this wonderful devotee which gives us insights on how to become a recipient of God's love.

xpjZN72Mhxg.title: Significance of the 96th Birthday of Sri Sathya Sai
xpjZN72Mhxg.description:
Every thought, word or action of the Divine is with a meaning and purpose. Sri Sathya Sai Baba On the 5th of October, 2003, Swami said in His Vijaydashami discourse - 

"I am always healthy. Not only today, till 96 years I will be like this. I can do whatever I want. But those who go by the physical form think that Swami is ageing. Youth and old age are related to the body and not to Me. I am always the same. I can do anything. However, this body is yours. This has come for your sake. You can change it the way you like."

The 96th Birthday on the 23rd of November, 2021, thus gains added significance. What is the inner secret of 96? Why did Swami leave 10 years before that 'age'? Two personal experiences - the closure of Worldspace Radio in 2009 and the falling of the Kalpavriksha in 2011 - present an interesting and inspiring insight.

GkR-luBjTDM.title: An Experience in Enlightenment | Story of Bhagia Sir | Satsang
GkR-luBjTDM.description: Enlightenment or Moksha is not something that is achieved with death. It is full of life - so full that what we generally consider as life appears 'dead' in front of it! It has been my fortune to have met and interacted with a few people who have had this experience and Bhagia sir is one among them. His experience is phenomenal, no doubt, but it also gives us a clear road on how to achieve enlightenment or moksha despite living in the 'mundane' world. The method is only strengthened by the experience of Sri Paramahamsa Yogananda as captured in his book - Autobiography of a Yogi.

tlAxJsc72x8.title: A Muslim finds his Allah in Sri Sathya Sai | Abdul Razak Korbu experience
tlAxJsc72x8.description: Dr. Abdul Razzaq Korbu, a lecturer from the state of Maharashtra in India fell in love with Sri Sathya Sai Baba when he first set his eyes on Him. The way He was drawn to Swami is a beautiful leela in itself. The miraculous experiences did not stop after that and Dr. Abdul went on to write an entire book on his experiences with Swami.

1FYihQb8N4E.title: How to deal with disappointment | Satsangh | Personal Experiences
1FYihQb8N4E.description:
Imagine something unexpected happened to us and gave us great joy. We don't ask God, "Why? Why did this happen?" We happily accept it and maybe also think that we deserved it. But then, when something unexpected happens that makes us sad, we begin asking all sorts of questions to God. We firmly believe that we didn't deserve what happened. 

Here are two personal experiences with Swami, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, that highlights this aspect and also provides a solution to overcome disappointment.

wSOBL2eV0wg.description: Dr. Art Ong Jumsai experienced the love and grace of Sri Sathya Sai Baba in the midst of the second world war in the most harrowing circumstances. The best part is that Swami acknowledged the miraculous incident decades later!

-cauBQE9B6A.title: Darkness to Light | Tamasoma Jyotirgamaya | Satsangh
-cauBQE9B6A.description:
It is only in the depths of darkness that we learn to appreciate light and it is always darkest before dawn. However dark the night might be, we should hold on in faith and God WILL definitely bring light into our lives. This is highlighted beautifully from the life experiences of two of Swami's teachers - Dr. T Ravikumar and Ms. Rama Devi. 

At the end of their experiences, we realize that the 'light' we speak of is the light of love and nothing else. May we treasure and share that light with everyone everywhere. Samastha Lokaha Sukhino Bhavantu.

70KncMOaGUQ.title: Is Sathya Sai Baba same as Jesus | James Sinclair Experience
70KncMOaGUQ.description: "It is unfair that Christ walked the earth 2000 years ago and I am in a time when I cannot see Him..." That was the complaint of Mr. James Sinclair and Jesus indeed decided to (literally) walk into his life. An experience that reinforces that Truth that whatever name or form of God you worship, it is the same divine principle that responds.

OUYt35s7KjY.title: How to Achieve Work Life Balance | Making the best of your profession
OUYt35s7KjY.description: Once we graduate and start our careers, we are enveloped with the problem of balancing work and life. How to ensure that work doesn't become a burden we bear just to eke out a living? The answer lies in the attitude we bear towards 'work'. The examples of Swami's driver and Swami's Director of the Super Specialties Hospital teach us the way to transform whatever work we do into something that uplifts us.

GYKsUqmR-9g.title: Religions are Many God is One | Story of the Sarva Dharma Symbol
GYKsUqmR-9g.description: Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba created the Sarva Dharma symbol as a pen sketch in 1967. What was His idea behind it? Why did He restrict it to only 5 religions? A dive into history shows us how broadminded and largehearted Swami is. It inspires us to be the same and practice expansion-love. This is also the beautiful story of how the 5-petaled symbol and 6-petaled symbol co-exist as captured by Dr. John Hislop in his book - Conversations with Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba.

XCX8tRkJW_I.title: The Miracles We Miss Daily In Life | Satsang
XCX8tRkJW_I.description:
Who does not want a miracle in life? Everyone wants at least one! But, it appears as though God picks and chooses certain individuals for miracles. Nothing can be more wrong than this. Our own limitations blind us to the many miracles that keep happening in our lives. The biggest limitation is our expectation of a miracle to be 'fast' and 'instantaneous'.

This talk covers a 'cancer cancel' miracle that took place instantly along with the apparently 'ordinary' story of Praveen, who went on to head the administration at the Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Medical Sciences at Bangalore. There are insights to be gained on developing our ability to recognise these 'slow miracles'.

Finally, a personal experience as Swami's photographer which thumped this message right into my being!

This talk was delivered at the Satsangh Hall in Prasanthi Nilayam on the 10th of June, 2016.

S9Vq6F5Dccs.title: Divine Mother | Navarathri Satsang | Sri Sathya Sai
S9Vq6F5Dccs.description: The Divine Mother's love is that of a thousand mothers' love it is said. What does that actually mean. One one hand, it speaks of the intensity; on the other, it also refers to God's ability to shower that motherly love on thousands at the same time. In this satsangh there are three beautiful episodes which show Sai Maa's divine love.

Iw_MXd4lAIE.title: How Death is a great Motivator for Life | Important vs Urgent
Iw_MXd4lAIE.description: Thoughts of death are often considered fatalistic or pessimistic. But actually, they can be realistic and help us with priorities. Here is a simple technique by which thoughts of death can be turned into a powerful motivator in our day to day lives. And there is a powerful example shared by Swami, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, which we too can draw motivation from.

DOUuctBNA7w.title: Direct Connect to God without Intermediaries | SATSANGH
DOUuctBNA7w.description:
Lacking a direct connection with God is akin to being a 'smartphone' without a 'SIM card'! Like a SIM card, irrespective of the name of the connecting service, the connection is personalised and unique. The life experience of Nikhil Koushik, my classmate in MBA at the Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning, shows how firm Swami is in emphasising on the direct connect.

What is the ONLY quality needed to achieve this connect with God? Harish's experience in Sai Kulwant Hall makes it clear. How do we achieve this quality? 

This talk was delivered in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 16th of September, 2016.

4PbHe805afE.title: Coping with the ups and downs of life | Lesson from Mahabharata
4PbHe805afE.description:
The game of life is like a game of snake and ladders. Why does one arrive at a snake's mouth? Why does one arrive at the foot of a ladder? That is hard to explain and understand but how we respond to either of the situations gives us an indication on how mature our devotion is. 

Our Swami, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, gives us 2 examples from the life of the Pandavas to show how we normally respond to ups and downs of life. These examples are very powerful (as always) and give us valuable insights on conducting our day to day lives.

agBNoZuuy48.title: Does Ganesha always remove obstacles? | Vighneshwara meaning |
agBNoZuuy48.description: Ganesha is called as the remover of all obstacles. Why then do even the most devout worshippers of Lord Ganesha face obstacles? The reason is very simple - it is because Lord Ganesha loves His devotees a lot. Ganesha is called 'Vighneshwara' meaning 'Lord of Obstacles' and that term has a meaning hidden in it. Just knowing this made my heart rejoice and feel strengthened.

WQteEo6XNKA.title: Three Lessons from Draupadi Vastraharan| Mahabharat Messages | Sathya Sai Wisdom
WQteEo6XNKA.description:
One of the critical turning points in the Mahabharata story is the attempted disrobing of Draupadi in the open Kaurava court. The sequence of events that happen bring to us three powerful and beautiful lessons as elucidated by Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba in His many discourses. These are answers to the questions - 
0:56 1. How far is God from us? 
2:07 2. What is surrender? 
2:55 3. Why it makes sense to offer oneself to God alone?

4c4OHJ3dBkA.title: Understanding Obstacles and Problems | Krishna Janmashtami and Ganesh Chaturthi Messages | Satsangh
4c4OHJ3dBkA.description:
Obstacles and problems occur in everyone's life and devotees of God are no exception to them! Looking back into my days with Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba as His student in the school & University, I remember two very important lessons learnt from the twin festivals - Krishna Janmashtami and Ganesh Chaturthi. The former taught me with God by the side, no obstacle can ever stop us. The latter taught me that even if an obstacle presents itself when God is by our side, it only is a messenger with a message. The obstacle disappears once the lesson is learned!

Well, God by our side is a given... The rest depends on our attitude & prayer...

pYVbA4rqSWU.title: Was Sita punished by Rama | Aryan Goutham Adventures | Sathya Sai Wisdom
pYVbA4rqSWU.description: One of the biggest accusations levelled against Sri Rama is that he doubted his chaste wife Sita even after she had undergone a trial by fire, and that too based on the words of a common washerman. However, when we read the Ramakatha Rasa Vahini authored by Sri Sathya Sai Baba, we understand the truth.  Meet Aryan and Goutham, the twins whose similarities end with their looks. However, their different perspectives about life bring us many insights. The truth behind Sita's 'punishment' is brought about as a discussion between these lovable twins.

BELGOBPJpsI.title: Students' interview with Sri Sathya Sai Baba (March 2000) | Trayee Session
BELGOBPJpsI.description:
We travelled to Whitefield (Bangalore) from Puttaparthi as the graduating 12th grade class. To our greatest delight, Swami called us into His residence (Trayee Brindavan) for an interview. What followed was an unforgettable session in which Swami dilated on 2 things to remember and 2 things to forget. There was also a miracle when He refused the usual translator and had the entire Telugu discourse translated by Dr. Sailesh Srivastava who was a native Hindi-speaker. 

The interview concludes with a couple of emotionally charged songs. 

The whole video gives a good idea of what it meant to be in a Trayee Session with Swami and how passionately He conveys the greatest truths in the most simple and elegant manner.

CxHyUyqYqDM.title: Why you should not be judgemental? | Personal Experience | Sri Sathya Sai Baba
CxHyUyqYqDM.description:
It was the Dusshera celebrations in 2009. One aspect of the celebrations angered me to no end and I wanted to give a piece of my mind to a few people. And my dear Swami, Sri Sathya Sai Baba, seemed to encourage me in this. But He was building it up for a grand climax. 

Discrimination or the ability to differentiate gets distorted and makes us judgemental. Every day of our adult lives, we are probably judging others constantly. The problem in this is two fold:
1. We do not know what the other person is actually going through.
2. It becomes tough to love someone when you are judging him/her. 

God loves everyone and therefore judges none. That is a virtue that all of us, His 'Premaswaroopulara' MUST imbibe.

H0c3Nmlr_J0.title: Overcoming Habits and Addictions | True Independence | Sathya Sai Wisdom
H0c3Nmlr_J0.description: Bad habits and addictions are problems that many of us face. We want to give them up but struggle to do so. The approach towards giving up a habit is different from the approach towards giving up an addiction. Using one for the other could have disastrous consequences at worst or no consequences at best. Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba provides insights on why and how we should give up habits and addictions through very easy-to-understand examples and experiences.

MQEADhKUlNw.title: Shraddha and Saburi | True Meaning | Sri Sathya Sai Baba Experience
MQEADhKUlNw.description:
Shraddha (faith) and Saburi (patience) are actually two sides of the same coin. Faith is not faith unless it is time-tested. Patience without faith is meaningless. If one possesses this coin with its two faces, the grace of the Guru is sure to take care of all needs and wants. That is what my Guru, Sri Sathya Sai Baba, promises during His discourse on the 24th July, 1964, on the occasion of Guru Poornima. These are not mere words as the mind-boggling and miraculous experience of DR Harish, an alumnus of the Sri Sathya Sai College, shows. It is indeed a miracle of faith and patience being rewarded by the Guru's grace.

0:00 Introduction
1:28 Radhabai Story
2:29 Should I fast?
5:56 Both God and Effort necessary
7:18 Avoid anything that takes you away from Guru
9:52 Harish's mind-blowing experience starts
25:56 Conclusion

kqC63VP11r0.description:
Surrender is the surest and quickest way to peace in life. This was the discovery of Mr. Hari Hara Krishnan, the finance controller for NCR Corporation in Kuwait, during the sudden invasion by Iraq. This is as much a story of the devotee's faith as it is of the Guru's grace. 

Travel along with Mr. Hari in this roller coaster journey replete with miracles, lessons and insights. You may read the entire story if you wish to on Radiosai's blog at the link below.

5tY3X0TAXGI.title: How God or Guru Deals With Karma | Personal Experience
5tY3X0TAXGI.description:
Karma becomes very complicated to understand once we realize that reactions can span across lifetimes. This lack of understanding is what leads us to bemoan that God who is described as an ocean of kindness and the embodiment of compassion is doing nothing to relieve us of our woes. On the contrary, our God or Guru seems to be the source and cause of our miseries! 

God/Guru is verily the embodiment of Love and Truth and is an ocean of Compassion. Everything done is for our highest good as I realized through this initially painful but ultimately joyful, roller-coaster ride of an experience with Sri Sathya Sai Baba.

nJJhcrbA_PI.title: God's Timing is Always Perfect | Hold On and Wait On
nJJhcrbA_PI.description:
Many times in life, we feel that God is not responding as quickly as He should. His delays are not His denials, but why should He ever delay? Why does He have to wait till the last minute before coming to the rescue?

Based on a couple of personal experiences with Sri Sathya Sai, here are some insights on God's perfect timing. The important thing to note here is that God is not waiting for the 'perfect time' because even an 'unlucky day' or 'unlucky time' can be easily made fruitful by Him. Then what is He waiting for?

This talk was delivered on the 28th of March 2016 in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam and it attempts to answer some of these questions.

7bWmup6hI20.title: नामस्मरण - निरन्तर नाम जपते रहने का प्रभाव
7bWmup6hI20.description: नामस्मरण ठीक उसी प्रकार है जिस प्रकार एक किसान अपने खेत को जोतता है या पानी की धार से पत्थर कट जाता है ।एक व्यक्तिगत अनुभव से मैंने जाना कि किसी भी विचार को निरन्तर सोचते या दोहराते रहने से उसका गहरा प्रभाव  होता है ,और जब ये चिंतन भगवान के नाम व स्वरूप का किया जाए तो इसके परिणाम जादुई और चमत्कारी होते हैं । इसका एक उदाहरण भाई रवि मरिवल्ला का भी है । आइये इसे जानने का प्रयास करते हैं ।

arYzG4b2_ag.title: Intention is more important than the Means or Ends | Satsangh| Sai Student Experiences
arYzG4b2_ag.description:
What we do is important. How we do it is more important. But the most important is why we do it! The intention with which we do anything is what ultimately matters in life. Intention is what God/Guru looks at also. A beautiful story from the Bhagavatha Purana and the life experience of a Sai Student clearly show us that the Lord will go to any extent when the devotee's intent is pure. 

The power of intention also puts to rest the debate on whether means justify the ends or ends justify the means. The end is 'what' we do and the means is 'how' we do. If 'why' we do something is good, then ends justify means and means justify ends. Else, nothing is justified!

This was a Zoom Satsangh delivered to the devotees of Sri Sathya Sai Baba in Sri Lanka.

y6GFNB3NkOE.title: Goal Focus or Path Focus | Means vs Ends | Debate
y6GFNB3NkOE.description:
Success is something all of us seek. Does it lie in the destination? Or is it in the journey? Another way of asking the same thing is whether the ends justify the means we adopt or do the means we adopt justify whatever end we reach? What is the intricate relationship and balance between the two when it comes to ethics and spirituality? 

All these are beautifully answered through an experience where Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba taught this in His inimitable Divine style to a student of His University. As always, He makes it so simple in the end.

N-u3xv0bSR0.title: सर्वव्यापी स्वामी की उपस्थिति कैसे महसूस करें?
N-u3xv0bSR0.description: आज जब स्वामी भौतिक देह में हमारे बीच मौजूद नहीं हैं तो क्या तब भी हम उनकी उपस्थिति महसूस कर सकते हैं ? अगर हमें ये अटूट विश्वास है कि स्वामी भगवान हैं ,तो निःसन्देह हम उन्हें सदैव महसूस कर सकते हैं ।आइये,कुछ ऐसी सच्ची घटनाओं के माध्यम से समझते हैं कि स्वामी सर्वव्यापी हैं,और उन्होंने भक्तों की पुकार का वैसे ही उत्तर दिया जैसे कि भगवान नारायण ने गजेंद्र नामक हाथी की पुकार पर उसकी रक्षा करके दिया था ।

qAN3K4lggKI.title: Funny Episodes in Sathya Sai's Presence | Sai Humour | Insights
qAN3K4lggKI.description: Sri Sathya Sai's sense of humour is an experience that is unforgettable. These episodes are often narrated and relived. However, there have been many humorous incidents in His presence which have elicited hearty laughter at the expense of the students, teachers, speakers or EVEN SWAMI! On later introspection, these incidents reveal deep flaws and insights about our own psyches and personalities. Here is a bouquet of such funny incidents in Swami's presence from which we can learn a lot.

Z83rxaX91nI.title: Best Prayer To God | Miraculous Experience
Z83rxaX91nI.description:
Prayers are mostly understood as what we ask from God. Going by that definition, we need to be extremely careful what we ask from God. Why? Because it will be granted!!

Yes! I am not joking. My uncle's experience in the 1960s is both funny and insightful about why we need to be careful in what we pray for.

pCKXZXaYGug.title: Lessons from a Train Journey
pCKXZXaYGug.description: A train journey (especially in India) is very metaphorical for our life journey. There are multiple lessons and insights that we can glean from such a journey. Come, let us start early, drive slowly and reach safely carrying as less luggage as possible to make this travel a pleasure.

TjyFQzeO9Z8.title: हम तेरे हैं साई - अरविंद बालसुब्रमण्य
TjyFQzeO9Z8.description:
ये कहना कि, "स्वामी, आप मेरे हो" और ये कहना कि, "स्वामी, मैं आपका हूँ", इन दोनों में बहुत अंतर है ।इस अंतर को समझने से हमें पता चल जाता है कि - स्वामी मैं आपका हूँ  - इस कथन का सच्चा अर्थ क्या है ? स्वामी के अनेक छात्रों के अनुभवों से भरी हुई ये लघु वार्ता हमारे हृदय में स्वामी के प्रति भरे हुये अथाह प्रेम के सागर की लहरों को एक बार पुनः उत्साहित कर उमंगों से भर देती है ।


The credit for the beautiful "Hum Tere Hain Sai" song rendering is to brother Saurav Sharma (@sailestial melodies). Don't miss listening to it at the link below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QftH7qhhvqU

mkUZybNRWc0.title: Two Things to Forget and Two to Remember | Sathya Sai Advice
mkUZybNRWc0.description:
If only we are ready to forget 2 things, we can achieve ultimate peace in life. But alas! Erasing things from our mind at will is not as easy as it sounds! It becomes possible only we are ready to remember 2 things!

What are these 2 things to forget and 2 things to remember? Sathya Sai explains it so beautifully and simply. This was part of the discourse that Swami delivered to us 12th Grade students during an interview session in Trayee Brindavan in early 2000. These lessons have been validated for me via personal experiences - one before travelling with Swami to Delhi and the other during a drive to my aunt's place in Thane, Mumbai.

This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 17th of March, 2017.

(During the talk, I think I forgot to complete the narration of one incident involving Prof. Anil Kumar. Here is the completion:
When Swami asked him what He should do to the ones that had complained against him, he replied, 
"Swami, forgive them."
Swami was so happy and he lovingly embraced the genial professor.)

yPjm3uWCl24.title: The Power of Gayatri Mantra | Sri Sathya Sai Reveals
yPjm3uWCl24.description:
The Gayatri Mantra is a highly revered hymn from the Rig Veda which came to the world through Maharshi Vishwamitra. This simple Mantra is very powerful and miraculous. This is probably the only Mantra that Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba actually prescribed to people of all ages, gender and backgrounds to chant anywhere at any time. Here is an insightful revelation that Swami made in the interview room to Dr. Vijai Kumar in the 1980s.

It is a reaffirmation of why the Gayatri is considered to epitomize all the four Mahavakyas of Sanathana Dharma.

LCQinRYHuEk.title: देर भी नहीं, अंधेर भी नहीं | अरविंद बालसुब्रमण्य
LCQinRYHuEk.description: कई बार हमारे मन में प्रश्न उठता है कि क्या भगवान हमारी प्रार्थना का उत्तर देते हैं या नहीं ? कई बार लगता है कि भगवान से हमने जो मांगा वो मिला तो सही ,मगर बड़ी देर से । कहा जाता है कि भगवान के घर देर है ,अंधेर नहीं है । मगर क्या सचमुच में भगवान के घर देर है ? या ये हमारा भ्रम मात्र है ? इन प्रश्नों के जवाब भगवान श्री सत्य साई बाबा के प्रत्यक्ष सानिध्य में मिले हैं, जिन्हें इस वार्ता में प्रस्तुत किया जा रहा है । ये उदबोधन श्री सत्य साई सेवा संगठन छत्तीसगढ़ के साई भक्तों के समक्ष डिजिटल माध्यम से 16 मई 2021 को दिया गया था । साईराम ।

nvC9Dz54atU.title: Importance of Going Within | Satsangh
nvC9Dz54atU.description:
There are only two ways to go while dealing with any situation - outward and inward. And the best way is indicated by our dear Sri Sathya Sai's name - SAI (See Always Inside). Our life's journey begins ONLY when we start going inwards. That was the message Swami gave our class during the Independence Day drama programme on 15th August 2004. That was the message Swami gave Prof. Kasturi and other devotees way back in 1948. That is the way to do true Seva (Service) too as Swami explained in multiple discourses.  It is only by going within will we be happy because we will be free of external dependencies. 

On many occasions Swami made it clear that the goal of the Sri Sathya Sai Avatar or the Sri Sathya Sai Organization is to take each individual within, towards the Truth. Going within is the only way we can keep Swami's legacy alive too...

l41soZpo0wI.title: Mothers Day Message from a Special Mother's Life | Easwaramma Day Satsangh
l41soZpo0wI.description:
Mother Easwaramma shouldered the unique 'opportunity' and 'burden' of being mother to Sri Sathya Sai Baba. May 6th is celebrated as Easwaramma Day and Children's Day every year. Why do we celebrate a day when Mother Easwaramma died? The answer has been provided by Swami Himself through the narration of the poignant episode on May 6th 1972. Two points come out strongly from her life:
1. The Mother was foremost among devotees.
2. The Lord is ready to become a 'son' for His devotee. 

Wishing everyone a happy and holy Mothers Day. Hope you enjoy this talk which was originally delivered to the SSE Gurus and Students of the Sathya Sai Baba Center of Cooksville in Canada.

0b5-bn1ERw8.title: Think Before You Speak | Aryan & Goutham Adventures | Sathya Sai Wisdom
0b5-bn1ERw8.description:
What are things to consider and think about before speaking? 

Meet Aryan and Goutham, the twins whose similarities end with their looks. However, their different perspectives about life bring us many insights. 

In this episode, we learn of a powerful and effective technique to build good relationships, maintain self-respect and, most importantly, retain peace of mind. It is based on wisdom that Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba shared in many public and private discourses.

Yh_q6twJXiw.title: A Smile Can Change Your Life | Satsangh |
Yh_q6twJXiw.description:
As children, many of us have imagined ourselves to be superheroes of various kinds only to have the imaginations snatched away as adults. However, there is one superpower that we rarely imagined, possibly because we already owned it! And that is the power of the smile which can be used to create miracles. 

The power of a smile is not to be underestimated nor can it ever be overestimated because it is immense. Laced with personal incidents and powerful experiences of others, this talk will hopefully bring a smile on the face. :)

This talk was delivered in the Satsangh Hall of Prasanthi Nilayam, the abode of Sri Sathya Sai Baba, on the 11th of August, 2017.

l0sNAb_N4SY.title: Are You Dear To God? | Poem Inspired By Sathya Sai Baba | Motivation Video
l0sNAb_N4SY.description:
Voice Credit: DV Hemant Kumar.
How do you know that you are near and dear to God? How do you know that God is dear to you? This is a poem that was written by Mr. Joel, husband of Diana Baskin and it is recorded in her book titled - Divine Memories of Sathya Sai Baba.  

The words of the poem are given below:

Dear Loved One,
You ask: How will you know when I am near you?
When on a sultry night
Everything is hot and still
The first cool breeze brushes your cheek
I am caressing you
Think of Me.
When the pangs of hunger are satisfied
and loneliness is pierced by happiness
Think of Me.
When your mouth is parched
and you can hardly speak
The first sip of cool water
I am soothing you
Think of Me.
When the cloud of death disappears
first on the opening of a baby’s smiling eyes
Think of Me.
When I sprinkle your face with rain
and wash the earth, the dry brown leaves
The first smell of clean rain
I am cleansing you
Think of Me.
When pain dissolves
and fear disappears
Think of Me.
When steadfast eyes are horrified
by the cruelties of life
The first glances of the silent setting sun
I am comforting you
Think of Me.
Then you ask how will you know when you are near me?
When the burning sun has scorched you and the earth
The sand and dust fill your eyes
Not a silver of shade about
And you love Me.
When loneliness is accompanied by hunger
and not one can be satisfied
And you love Me.
When your lips are cracked
your tongue feels like clay
your throat seals up
There is no water about
Not even a mirage in sight
And you love Me.
When you hold a dying child
with eyes pleading
And you love Me.
When you stir the ocean to a crescent
You flounder in its depth like a leaf
And you love Me.
When i take from you your most
cherished possessions
On the first loss of your sight
darkness envelopes you
And you love Me.

For everything you see, hear, smell, taste or touch belongs to Me. So how can you give to Me what I already have but your love? And that I gave to you before time began as your sole possession. When you return it to Me, then will I know you are truly Mine and I will dissolve your sorrow and happiness into Me.
That….being Me, I will place you in bliss forever. for, I love and think of you constantly.
From your most loving Father

h0nFCJq0FwQ.title: The Greatest Secret | Satsangh
h0nFCJq0FwQ.description:
The greatest secret is not actually a secret. But are we able to recognize it? More importantly, are we able to utilize it to improve our lives and make a vast difference - to ourselves and others as well?

This is a talk that begins with a suspenseful episode where my Guru, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, said that He would reveal the greatest secret in a private address to the students. For study purposes, the Secret arrives to us in 2 parts and both of them are necessary because adherence to only one part leads to imbalance. The importance of faith and self-confidence also get revealed.

This speech was delivered in the Satsangh hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 8th of September, 2017.

xJLyQAEZ0Zw.title: Sri Sathya Sai Ashtothram | 108 names | Sai Students Version |
xJLyQAEZ0Zw.description:
The 108 names (Ashtotaram) of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba rendered in the style that the Sai Students chant in the Mandir/College/Hostel with apt pictures to help visualise our Swami. Meaning given below:

1) Let us bow down to Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba (the true Divine Mother and Father of all)
2) Who is the Embodiment of Truth
3) Who is solely devoted (to preaching) to Truth and Righteousness
4) Who is the Giver of boons
5) The One Who is all pervading
6) Who is the Embodiment of the virtue, Truth
7) Who promotes the quality of piety, righteousness
8) Who nourishes the sustains pious people
9) Who is omniscient
10) Who is dear to all

11) Who is the Embodiment of all powers
12) Who is the Lord of all
13) Who has given up all attachments
14) Who is the Indweller of all hearts
15) Who is Glory Personified
16) Who is the Embodiment of Shiva
17) Who is born in a village called Parthi
18) Who is the Resident of the region of Parthi
19) Who is famous in the previous body as the Resident of Shirdi
20) Who has taken the form of the female and male aspect (Shiva and Shakti) in the primeval village

21) Who is born in the Gothra of Bharadhwaj Rishi
22) Who has parental affection of devotees
23) Who is the inner Atma in all
24) Who is the manifestation of the divine Incarnation
25) Who removes all fears
26) Who is identical with the Apasthamba lineage
27) Who bestows freedom from fear
28) The One Who is born in the dynasty of Ratnakara (gems of men)
29) Who is the incarnation of power not different from that of Shirdi

30) Who is Shankara (Shiva)
31) Who is the Incarnation of Shirdi Sai
32) Who is the Resident of Dwarakamayi
33) Who sports (His Leelas) in Puttaparthi on the banks of the Chitravathi river
34) Who bestows strength
35) Who is the Savior of those who surrender
36) Who is Bliss
37) Who grants Bliss
38) Who is devoted solely to saving the afflicted (those in distress)
39) Who is the Guardian or Lord of the destitute
40) Who is the Helper of the helpless

41) Who is a brother to the whole world
42) Who is solely devoted to protecting the people
43) Who is the Lord of all worlds
44) Who nourishes and sustains the poor (those who are in a miserable condition)
45) Who is the Incarnation of the Holy Trinity (Brahma, Vishnu and Maheshwara)
46) Who is the Giver of Liberation
47) Who removes wickedness
48) Who is compassionate
49) Who is the Support of all
50) Who resides in the heart of everyone

51) Who is the Giver of the fruits of merit
52) Who is the Destroyer of all sins
53) Who removes all diseases
54) Who takes away all afflictions
55) The One Who is the Creator and Who is praised endlessly
56) Who is Primeval Purusha (the very first from the Lord)
57) Who is the Primal Energy
58) He Who has delightful and wonderful powers
59) Who is the form of the Unmanifested (the Formless)
60) Who destroys desire and anger

61) Who wears a golden-colored robe
62) Whose activities are astonishing, unprecedented
63) Who guides like a brother in calamity
64) Who is Love Personified
65) Who is the Embodiment of Love
66) Who grants Love
67) Who is loved by all
68) Who is dear to devotees
69) Who is the highest peak (Divine Mountain) to the Bhaktha
70) Who plays (happily) in the hearts of devotees

71) Who dwells in the heart of the Bhaktha
72) Who is at the command of the devotees
73) Who ignites the blazing lamp of Bhakthi and knowledge in us
74) Who shows the path of Bhakthi which leads to Jnaana (knowledge)
75) Who shows the path of attaining the right knowledge
76) Who is Knowledge Personified
77) Who is the Teacher of the Gita
78) Who grants the achievement of wisdom
79) Who has a charming Form
80) Who is the embodiment of Purity (physical beauty, the sweetness of speech, compassion etc)

81) Who bestows the fruits of Karma
82) Who is the Supreme Person
83) Who is the most ancient Supreme Person
84) Whose Glory transcends the three worlds
85) Who is beyond the limits of time
86) Who is the Embodiment of all accomplishments
87) Whose Will is immediately effective
88) Who grants good health
89) Who is the sustainer of all beings (He gives food and clothing)
90) Who destroys the suffering of the mundane existence

91) Who grants desirable objects to all
92) Whose virtues are beneficial
93) Who destroys the (binding force of) Karma
94) Who is an ornament to righteous minds
95) Who accepts all religions
96) Who is the Cleanser of the mind of the aspirant
97) Who has established the banyan tree as a favor to the Sadhaka
98) Who destroys all doubts
99) Who teaches the essence of all knowledge
100) Who is the Lord of all Yogis

101) Who is revered by all the Masters of Yoga
102) Who is the Granter of all auspiciousness and prosperity
103) Who grants all accomplishments and skills
104) Who removes all calamities
105) Who takes away bodily and mental pains
106) Who is the Personification of Peace
107) Who is easy to please
108) Let us bow down to Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba (the true Divine Mother and Father of us all)

RueS1cXynns.title: What to do when Sadhana gets boring | Satsangh Talk
RueS1cXynns.description:
Spirituality is meant to be vibrant and full of bubbling joy. Yet, I went through a very difficult period where I felt bored and stagnant. Why does that happen? The answer lies in the answer to these questions which are all connected to the mind. 
1. Why do we remember our 'firsts' in life and not the later similar/same experiences?
2. Why did Swami insist on His students wearing the white dress?
3. Why do we feel the need for a Japamala for doing Namasmarana?
4. Why did Swami insist on 'LOVE' being the ultimate solution? 
and FINALLY,
5. Why do we do Sadhana? 

The narration includes a couple of experiences including personal ones where we pleaded with Swami to start walking and one where I never ever wanted to go to the Mandir again after 2011. Also included is my technique to ensure my heart is bubbling with love for Swami always.

This was a talk delivered in the Satsangh hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 7th of June 2019.

3h0mxsph2rU.title: Overcoming Bullies | Why fear when I am here | Sri Sathya Sai
3h0mxsph2rU.description: Fear is a natural response when we are up against someone or something more powerful, resourceful or influential than us. But this happens only because we forget that the most powerful and loving force - God - is with us ALWAYS. Here is a moving and powerful reminder of Sathya Sai's protective and bountiful grace through the life experience of Anantappa as recorded by Swami's biographer, Prof. N Kasturi.

wdd5VRLXKz4.title: Significance of Maha Shivarathri | Satsangh
wdd5VRLXKz4.description:
Mahashivarathri holds a very unique and special significance in Prasanthi Nilayam because of multiple reasons. The foremost among them is the Truth revealed by Sri Sathya Sai Baba Himself on His identity as Shiva-Shakti. This talk relives the episode from 28th June to 5th July 1963. The other reason is the magnificent Lingodbhava that Swami would perform. What is it's significance? What does it teach us? We learn this through a couple of beautiful personal experiences on Shivarathri.

This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh Hall in Prasanthi Nilayam on the 9th of February, 2018.

DApFzXv-4sE.title: Effectiveness of a Toss for Decision Making | God's Choice
DApFzXv-4sE.description: Tossing or picking lots after sincerely praying for an answer is a method that many of us use in decision-making when we are just unable to decide what to do. How effective is this method? Here is the real-life experience of my classmate who took tossing to the next level. Based on that experience and the words of wisdom from a close devotee of Sri Sathya Sai Baba - Diana Baskin - here are some insights on the effectiveness of tossing in decision-making

QTk2NJs68Ok.title: Law of Karma explained in Four Simple Statements
QTk2NJs68Ok.description:
The Law of Karma, one of the most important messages of the Bhagawad Gita, can get quite complicated to understand. However, it can be easily understood through four simple thumb rules. These rules also explain why bad happens to good people and vice versa. They also give us a good idea about the connection between destiny and freewill or human effort.

The most interesting aspect is how Karma gets affected when God comes into the picture as explained so beautifully by Sri Sathya Sai Baba.

uVBrZE1pXLw.title: SATSANGH: Why be good and appear good as well?
uVBrZE1pXLw.description:
Isn't it enough if I am good? Is there a need to appear good as well? When we go deeper, more problems are unearthed.

Wisdom states that the dual world will always have equal amounts of good and bad; light and darkness. That's the nature of duality.  Why then should one be good in the first place? 

Bhagawan Sri SathyaSai Baba inspires a powerful answer and also adds that it isn't enough just being good - one has to appear good too!

This gets highlighted in a very personal incident that I am sharing simply because the message is very powerful. It was an experience that got me many tense moments, a few crying moments but ended on an enlightening note, as is the case always with the Master.

This is a talk delivered on the 17th of February, 2017 in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam, Puttaparthi.

6vC5mY4LnVg.title: The Importance of Regularity
6vC5mY4LnVg.description:
"Practice makes a man perfect" is a cliche for a reason! Regularity is the most important component of practice and the key to success especially in our spiritual journey. More legends have been created because of regularity rather than special skills or abilities. While Arjuna and Sabari are excellent examples of the power of regularity, we have a few modern-day Sai-students who reinforce this message for us through their experiences with Swami.

This was a talk delivered in the Satsangh hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 1st of December, 2017.

pmqqUUmcTZA.title: When Death Arrives, Are You Ready?
pmqqUUmcTZA.description:
Death is probably the only certainty in the physical world after birth. Then, why is it that we spend time, energy and resources preparing for all else (which are uncertain) but not for death? Possibly because death is depressing and thinking of death goes against the principle of "living in the present".

But as Sri Sathya Sai beautifully teaches, living in the present and learning from the past/planning for the future are not opposing principles. Once we understand this and go through the lives of some glorious devotees - Raman, Keya and Nandedkar - we will realize that we are wasting time if we are not preparing for this ultimate reality. We will also understand that death is actually inspiring and it helps us to live fully in every moment to sanctify our lives...

This is a talk delivered on the 15th of March, 2016 in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam.

q9F8VJ_yK1c.title: Why we need a Guru and how do we find one?
q9F8VJ_yK1c.description:
Just as a teacher is a must for education which helps us seek a living, a Guru is a must to help us succeed in life. The significance of the Guru and how EXACTLY should one seek a Guru is perfectly explained by Swami, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, through His words, anecdotes, analogies and stories.

It becomes extra special when one has the Sadguru or Jagadguru doubling as one's personal Guru too! This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam, on the festival of Holi, on 2nd March 2018.

6vcy2Qe6RSo.title: Why chant Samastha Loka mantra praying for happiness of everyone?
6vcy2Qe6RSo.description:
Why should we strive for the happiness & peace of others - family, friends, acquaintances, society and even the world? Some amazing incidents, stories and discoveries show that our happiness is strongly linked to the happiness of those around us.

Even if that is the case, what is the use of simply chanting the mantra - Samastha Lokaha Sukhino Bhavantu? Again, some memorable experiences with & teachings of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba make it crystal clear for us. They are sure to enthuse us to take up the sadhana of chanting very sincerely.

This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on the 7th of February 2020

CfRxCO9Momo.title: Why pleasing God is better than pleasing the world? (Satsangh)
CfRxCO9Momo.description:
The goal of pleasing God through actions is the best one we can probably have. God is often considered as a hard task-master because He/She is a perfectionist. However, there is a very important difference between how God judges us and how Man judges us. That difference clearly shows why it is easier to please God. The same difference also makes us understand the meaning of the statement - "All are equal in the eyes of God."

But should I choose to please God simply because it is easier to do that over pleasing the world? No! The greatest benefit of doing things to please God is the supreme peace that develops in our heart. This happens because of an important perspective-difference that doing things for God brings in.

With a couple of personal experiences and a couple of other student experiences, this talk focuses on why and how can one please God. This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh Hall in Prasanthi Nilayam on 19th February, 2015.

QRvhbMWszQM.title: When you feel stuck in life (Overcoming obstacles)
QRvhbMWszQM.description:
We feel stuck in life because of seemingly insurmountable obstacles or obstructions that never clear. What do we do at such times? How do we motivate ourselves and keep away that feeling of being trapped? 

Here is a story that has always liberated me whenever I felt stuck. To go along with it is also a personal life experience that involves my Guru - Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba. It is a life lesson on the power and purpose of perseverance.

W_TW1Yh2mlY.title: The Three Zeroes (Satsangh 1 hour)
W_TW1Yh2mlY.description:
The three zeroes is a spiritual concept that can scare the hell out of a person! In fact, when a lady asked Swami, Sri Sathya Sai Baba,  to shower her with "Sai Krupa", Swami asked her whether she was ready for the three zeros. When she got to know what are the three zeros, she asked,
"Swami can I have Sai Karuna instead?" (Karuna is compassion while Krupa is grace - loosely translated).

What are the three zeroes and why are they so scary? More importantly, why should we not fear them and why should we welcome them instead?

These questions are answered through a long fictional story involving Swami and four devotees - Kuber, Maithri, Vibhuti and Prasanna. The story may be fictional, but it's message isn't. At the end we realize how true happiness is different from what we consider as happiness.

This is a talk delivered on 12th February 2016 in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam.

cmdqhyYRws4.title: Nothing is bad - Hilarious story by Swami (use sub-titles)
cmdqhyYRws4.description:
"Nothing is bad in Srushti (creation); It is all the fault in your Drishti (vision)" says Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba. This is a hilarious story He narrates of the celestial sage Narada learning this lesson from a piece of excreta! 

This episode happened during an interview Trayee Session which Swami granted to us, the students of grade 12, in March 2000.

M6r0-10M_U0.title: How to give up attachment? | Relationship Management
M6r0-10M_U0.description:
Overcoming attachment is easier said than done! Often, when we say that we are in love or we are friends with someone, subconsciously it means that we are attached to them. This attachment carries the burden of expectations from either sides and results in broken hearts, pieces of which lie scattered along many life-journeys. However, is there a way of converting your attachment-weakness into your attachment-strength?

Here is a personal journey from attachment to love and the vital role my Guru, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, played in it. In the end, there is one technique which has worked wonders for me when it comes to overcoming attachments and I hope you will find it useful as well.

SG7VHjcNQpA.title: A Possessive God
SG7VHjcNQpA.description:
Why is God possessive when He is supposed to be beyond attachment and relationships? The simple and straightforward answer is, "For the devotees' good alone." That is the reason why God does each and everything that He does. 

The experiences of many people clearly show that it didn't matter to Bhagavan Sri Sathya Sai Baba whether you followed Him or any other name/form of the Guru/God. But again, some other experiences show that He is extremely possessive of the devotee. Even a moment's reflection and introspection opens our eyes to the magnanimous and magnificent Grace of Swami. 

This is a talk delivered in the Satsangh Hall at Prasanthi Nilayam on 14th September 2018.

fKmbu9Kywe4.title: Birds of Puttaparthi (60+ species)
fKmbu9Kywe4.description:
Bird-watchers and bird-photographers can delight themselves at  Puttaparthi, the abode of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba. This holy hamlet attracts millions of people from around the world annually. But what is possibly less known is that it also attracts hundreds of species of birds - permanent residents and migratory ones - just like the people who visit the place! 

Here are photos taken by Aravind Balasubramanya over the  years 2008 to 2012. There are little sunbirds, finches, munias and the large egrets, cranes and storks. The common crows, coots, sparrows, hens and mynas live in harmony with the rare malkohas, snipes and godwits.

In this video, you can enjoy over 70 birds in 7 minutes.

To know more, visit the following link

https://hubpages.com/entertainment/The-beautiful-birds-of-Puttaparthi

AIPvJe4sDI4.title: Interview with God (Four pointed questions)
AIPvJe4sDI4.description:
An interview with one's God is possibly every believer's dream come true. But imagine you are allowed only four questions to ask of Him/Her/It. What would be your questions to God? Here are my questions:
"Why don't I ever see you God?"
"How are you present everywhere and in all time?"
"Do you REALLY love me?"
"Why then do I suffer pain in life?"

I received the answers from my Swami, my God, through different experiences in life. This is an attempt to summarize 15 years of understanding into 5 minutes.

Xue2OMNLpyA.title: Miracles we miss in life (Slow Miracles)
Xue2OMNLpyA.description: Miracles are not exclusively conferred on some people alone. Everyone gets miraculous experiences. The problem lies in the fact that many of these miracles go unnoticed. Now, there are several reasons why they go unnoticed but, if we discover the key reason, we will get many miracles in our life.

WyK7FsSC3Ic.title: New Year Resolution (Satsangh) - The best one to make (2019)
WyK7FsSC3Ic.description:
The New Year Resolution is an annual practice. How do we make it most effective? By doing something that benefits us and giving up something that is harmful for us. However, we have to keep in mind that what we desire and what is good for us may be different! 

What is the best New Year resolution to make then? 

This is an hour long talk delivered at the Satsangh Hall in Prasanthi NIlayam on the 28th of December 2018.

jSCNnT53uAw.title: Prayer of Surrender (Self Help)
jSCNnT53uAw.description:
Immediate relief from depression, disappointment, frustration and irritation - that is what these magical words of surrender from a letter that Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba wrote to a devotee offer! 

Through this, Swami clearly outlines what Surrender to God means and, more importantly, what surrender does not mean! These are words spoken by the Master to anyone who is in need of help and is ready to trust patiently. 

You can read more about this beautiful concept of surrender explained by Baba in the link below: 

https://hubpages.com/religion-philosophy/A-dialogue-on-Surrender-with-Swami

(Music: Sai Shravanam , ResoundIndia studios)

WBmfqQ--BqA.title: Miracle garland dropping captured on video
WBmfqQ--BqA.description:
One breath-taking moment, nothing short of miraculous took place during a programme at Brindavan, Bengaluru, at the ashram of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba.

This is an episode that happened on the 23rd June, 2013, during the "One with Sai" concert at Brindavan, Whitefield (Bangalore). The timing at which the garland snaps and falls is simply superb and perfect. The compere narrates a brief story of Lord Krishna and says about Bhagawan Baba, "If Swami says cut, then it is cut..." - THE GARLAND CUTS AND FALLS!

You can read the entire details of this and much more at the following link:

http://media.radiosai.org/journals/vol_11/01JUL13/After-Bhagawan-Sri-Sathya-Sai-Baba-who.htm

rdBlJzknc_w.title: Which is the best way to God - Karma, Bhakti or Jnana?
rdBlJzknc_w.description:
As a species, we are obsessed with trying to find the best way to do anything. The Indian scriptures state that there are three main ways to reach God - Karma, Bhakti and Jnana. However, among these three, which is the best one? 

Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba has given an insight that will simply take your breath away. So, if you are interested in attaining the Ultimate Goal of human life, you can start by spending 5 minutes to watch this video.

Wa8K-6OQiwo.title: Anger Management tips (Sri Sathya Sai Baba)
Wa8K-6OQiwo.description:
Here are 4 tips from Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba on what we can do when we get angry. Each one is practical, unique and based on solid reasoning. 

Ultimate anger management is to be unaffected by anger and use anger as a tool to help someone! But for that, we must have absolute mastery over anger. Even if we don't have that, we should at least be able to control the way we express anger.

5RjodFUu-pI.description: So! It's the birthday of that special one... What is the best gift to give? Tough to say but here are two rules that will be really helpful to make a choice. They helped me make my choice when it came to my best friend's birthday.

xX8OXvFjy8c.title: Mind Vs Conscience - How to distinguish between the two voices?
xX8OXvFjy8c.description:
It is not as if we WANT to make the wrong decision by not listening to our conscience. The problem is, we don't know which is the voice of the conscience and which is that of the monkey mind! Here are four tips based on an experience with my Guru that will help in decision making.

You can read about this story at the link below.

https://hubpages.com/religion-philosophy/Swamis-Omnipresence-The-first-experience-as-a-student

he2w3F7IoFw.title: How Puttaparthi got its name? Unknown temple and its legend
he2w3F7IoFw.description: The town of Puttaparthi has many historical and legendary temples. When you visit this place, make sure you don't miss going to the Venugopalaswami Temple. This temple is a monument to the legend of Puttaparthi.

HwYDFhDbCBA.title: The greatest SECRET to success - Yad Bhavam Tad Bhavati
HwYDFhDbCBA.description: Sri Sathya Sai Baba oft quoted a Sanskrit phrase not seen in the Vedas, Upanishads, Puranas or the Geeta. If we ponder over it, this little phrase contains the powerful secret to the ULTIMATE SUCCESS in life! Multiple examples and experiences only add to the impact of this secret to success!

FEBEgglVKCw.title: Happiness vs Bliss - How to get bliss?
FEBEgglVKCw.description:
The pursuit of happiness turns out to be never-ending because even when we manage to find happiness, we find it hard to keep it. Why is it like this? Are we incapable of being happy or are we doing something wrong? 

Two separate interactions of two students with Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba give us the answer to these questions. Who would have thought that the solution is so simple and practical? 

The ABC of life = Always Be Cheerful. For that, we need the DEFG of life = Don't Ever Forget God!

dsQxILEKPCk.title: How to convince others that Sathya Sai Baba is God?
dsQxILEKPCk.description:
There are those that don't believe in God who criticise and make fun of those that do. The theist on the other hand is constantly trying to prove the existence of God to the atheist and can get quite violent and vulgar in defence. And there are those that criticise the name and form of the Guru/God you revere, because they revere another name/form! 

Having faced ridicule and criticism for my faith in Sri Sathya Sai Baba, here are my thoughts.

jc_XsGIKJl8.title: Why Yagnas and such rituals? Scientific explanation from Sri Sathya Sai Baba
jc_XsGIKJl8.description:
It would be foolish to consider Yagnas and other rituals as acts of foolishness or waste. They are actually investments for a wonderful future if done in the right spirit. Here is the spirit behind the ritual of the Yajna as explained by Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba. It is as scientific as it is elevating. 

If you wish, you could download a beautiful image of Bhagawan Baba behind the rising flames of the Vedapurusha Saptaha Jnana Yagna (Navarathri or Dusshera at Puttaparthi) from the link below:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1m-ZCQBOHeI1hU-lhbhrqlYXqHxm8rTN7/view?usp=sharing

nVpdykxiusA.title: How to handle criticism? Practical Technique from Sri Sathya Sai Baba
nVpdykxiusA.description:
Criticism is a reality. Even the Gods themselves are not spared of criticism. How one faces criticism, determines how one grows or decays. Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba made a powerful observation about criticism during an interview room session. During a public discourse, Swami also offered a practical technique to ensure that criticism always helps us progress using a personal example. 

You can read more about the subject of you wish from the following link:

http://aravindb1982.blogspot.com/2018/06/handling-criticism-and-abuse-sathya-sai-baba-wisdom.html

R2Bbx9_sKFM.title: Man smart but God smarter!
R2Bbx9_sKFM.description:
It was a plan I made to outsmart Swami (Sathya Sai Baba). When it backfired, I made a smarter plan... With multiple planning efforts, the learning was profound. It actually revealed the only weakness that Swami has which we can exploit. 

I ended up with a memorable photograph as a reward of all those efforts. The whole story in full detail can be read at the following blog:

https://hubpages.com/religion-philosophy/Love-is-Gods-only-weaknessand-our-only-strength

pPCxLbapU3E.title: Did I come late to Sathya Sai's fold?
pPCxLbapU3E.description:
"Why wasn't I blessed enough to get more from the physical form of Swami?" 

Almost all of us ask this question of our God when we compare ourselves with others who have received more. But we are missing a vital point when we think that those who received more actually received more. What is this secret? 

There are a couple of incidents that reveal this to us in a beautiful manner. Am sure, it will enthuse, encourage and enlighten us.

(The detailed article about this theme is located at:

https://hubpages.com/religion-philosophy/Pining-for-God-is-more-important-than-experiences-with-God-a-lesson-from-my-Master-Sri-Sathya-Sai)

5EoB9OVoqb4.title: Surrender Secrets from car driving (Sathya Sai)
5EoB9OVoqb4.description:
What is surrender? It is the only way to do everything in a manner that makes Swami happy or God happy. It is to ensure that everything is done in an equanimous manner. This equanimity is not easy to inculcate. For that, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba gave a mantra which when repeated often with faith will surely help. Swami explained it using the gears of a car! 

This was conferred in wonderful circumstances during the Athi Rudra Maha Yajnam at Chennai in January 2007. The recipient of the experience, Dr. Jagdish Chandra, revealed this personal experience for the benefit of mankind. 

(You can read about the same at the link below:

https://hubpages.com/religion-philosophy/A-dialogue-on-Surrender-with-Swami )

7CBNubAH1xY.title: The only TRUE DEVOTION according to Sri Sathya Sai Baba
7CBNubAH1xY.description:
"Do everything to please God and not the world."

But how do I know if my Swami is happy with what I have done? Here is an episode from the 1990s where Swami made evident the secret feedback mechanism that each one of us possess to know whether Swami is pleased with us or not. 

It happened during the industrial visit of the MBA students and am grateful to Prof. H.J.Bhagia of the Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning for sharing this beautiful learning.

w7WRrKrI_1M.title: Efforts and Results
w7WRrKrI_1M.description: It was apparently a very strange observation when Swami praised a 'bad student' and was strict on a 'good student'.  But then, the Guru/God is able to see that which normal eyes cannot. This revelation is also a liberating thought because it helps us learn how to go about our daily grind without getting frustrated, fearful or anxious.

E8OSraBTyk4.title: Sathya Sai's powerful message to the Youth on what they should do
E8OSraBTyk4.description:
During a personal interview session, Bhagawan Baba casually started speaking about a wedding feast to a student. The student had no idea that the 'casual', 'strange' and 'funny' conversation would lead to the most beautiful revelation, insight and message. 

As youth, what is the most important thing to do? As a corollary,  what is the most important thing to do having crossed the youth stage?

9lEk3quaq5E.title: Seeing God in all - How? (Practical Advaitha)
9lEk3quaq5E.description:
The ability to see God in everyone and everything is the key to enlightenment. But what does it mean at a practical level? I worship and revere my God, my Swami. Does it mean that I should worship with flowers and serve the feet of every person I come across? 

What should one do to be able to see God in all and yet function normally in day to day life?  This is a short talk based on the teachings of Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba.

vncT0ly4tNM.title: Faith and Self Confidence - Whats the difference?
vncT0ly4tNM.description:
We are told to develop Faith. At the same time, we are told to develop self-confidence. Isn't that like being told to be hot and cold at the same time? Aren't the two just opposites? 

Based on the teachings and experiences with Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba, here is one thought.

xAcf8g25r9A.title: Spiritual Investment: The long and short of it...
xAcf8g25r9A.description:
There is a vital point which is uncannily similar in financial investing and spiritual investing. When we pay such attention to money which comes and goes, how much more should we be attentive to spirituality which comes and grows?

Here is an experience with Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba (two actually) that leads us to ponder over this very important aspect of investing...

f7OW2s1S4t4.title: Happy 92nd Birthday to Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba
f7OW2s1S4t4.description: Bhagawan Baba was born before sunrise on the 23rd November 1926. Thus, though it was a Tuesday, as per Indian tradition, the sun had not yet risen and it was still the Monday or Somavara - the Karthika Somavara. On the occasion of the holy Karthika Somavara, the "star birthday" of our beloved Swami, here are few thoughts.

BvXqgMx02hc.title: Sathya Sai giving Padanamaskar to Sri Sailam students (read description)
BvXqgMx02hc.description:
The complete details of this video are described in the blog at:
http://aravindb1982.blogspot.in/2017/05/gods-push-is-always-for-greater-good-sathya-sai.html

The actual happenings of the video as taken from the blog is below:
"I had written a letter which I wanted to hand over to Him. In that letter, I had also written about the admission that I sought in His school. As Swami came close to me, I gave him the letter. Then, I bent down and kissed His lotus feet. I was satisfied. As I rose, I received an unexpected bounty - Swami looked at me and lovingly placed His hand on my head. When my eyes met His, He asked,
"You were the boy who spoke yesterday right?"
Was I thrilled at this recognition! I nodded with a beaming smile. Swami told the same to the then State President of the SSSO, Kerala. 
 What happened next is enshrined in my heart...
Swami was about two meters away from me when He suddenly stopped, turned to me and asked, 
"What are you studying?"
"Swami class 10"
"Class 11....after class 12 what?" (in Tamil)
"Swami whatever you say."
"No...Medical or Engineering ? Which do you like"
"Swami medical."
"Medical! Study Biosciences here and get good marks."

As Swami moved on, I felt that He had already granted me a seat in His school for the next academic year.

7_761L6v4Sg.title: Aravind Balasubramanya talk - "My life is my Message, Expansion is my Life"
7_761L6v4Sg.description:
When Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba was asked for His 'introduction', He sang a beautiful English song. One of the lines of that song is "My Life is My Message; expansion is my life."

A proper understanding of this single line is enough to help us understand the secret of life and what we should do with it. Peppered with many direct experiences with Swami, this talk attempts to understand this line from that song. 

This is a talk delivered via Skype for the Zone 6, National Conference in Canary Islands, on the 30th of April 2017.

Gv47mHMiqOs.title: Love all but trust none, especially people - Sathya Sai
Gv47mHMiqOs.description:
This is an excerpt from a discourse delivered in Sai Ramesh Hall in Brindavan, Bangalore on Easwaramma Day, 6th May, 2002. The translator is Sri.B.N.Narasimhamoorthy. 

Here is the English transcript of the translation of the discourse. (as done by the translator).

Here is a small matter. The other day, a devotee.... Swami's cars have become very old.... Swami, I am prompted to give you a car, you should accept it he told Swami. He brought the car. Three days are over... Swami is not looking at his face also... What is the reason? I have enough number of cars... My car I can give you; you can take it. 

Swami has no desire to travel in big cars....The foreign devotees sent them, therefore Swami has to keep them. Swami told him, "you can take my car."  Swami will never receive anything from anyone. Never... 

Even when Swami was coming here... Sreenivas came...He expressed his grief, "Swami, that person is feeling miserable. Please accept the car." 
Swami told him, "Shut up. Don't enter into these things. Let him take his car. I'll give my cars; you also take one and let him take one. I don't need these."

That is not real greatness. You should develop a sense of sacrifice. You have to demonstrate sacrifice. That is what Swami has ben practicing even since His childhood. If you follow the footsteps of Swami you will be become men of merit and fulfilment. You can even attain liberation. You should attain that liberation. 

Attainment of liberation! What is moksha? It is giving up one's attachment. You have to give up Moha or attachment. That is moksha or liberation. 

Love everyone. But don't trust men. Anybody who trusts men will be ruined. Love them. But don't trust. Then, what is the problem of trusting people? When we have faith in people, we get cheated. Love all Serve all. But don't believe them. 

Believe your own Atma (Self). Develop self-confidence. Develop divine feelings. Give up worldly feelings. Give up worldly feelings and develop Divine feelings. This is Dharma, the path of righteousness for man. 


Discourse link in Sathya Sai Speaks:

http://www.sssbpt.info/ssspeaks/volume35/sss35-09.pdf

Audio of the entire discourse from Radiosai:

http://dl.radiosai.org/DD_2002_05_06_ESHWARAMBA_DAY.mp3

Discourse link in Sathya Sai Speaks:

http://www.sssbpt.info/ssspeaks/volume35/sss35-09.pdf

Audio of the entire discourse from Radiosai:

http://dl.radiosai.org/DD_2002_05_06_ESHWARAMBA_DAY.mp3

FJoBerkUuq0.title: Sri Sathya Sai answers the vital question about our reality - Who am I?
FJoBerkUuq0.description:
Details of the video: 

It was the 31st of August, 2008. It was a tremendously momentous day for the alumni of Swami’s Institute working in various capacities at Prasanthi Nilayam and Brindavan. That morning, however, none of them had the slightest inkling of what was in store for them. And today, their dear Master and best friend for life, Bhagawan Sri Sathya Sai Baba had decided to confer on them the Secret to Life. This Secret is so profound but so subtle that one often misses it.Swami spoke only one thing - about the ONENESS. He said that there exists nothing else other than God. 

"There is no happiness or sorrow, no victory or defeat, because you are everything. You do not suffer - you are suffering itself. You do not enjoy - you are joy itself." It was an exposition on the greatest secret of life and all the details of the session are captured in that article at

http://aravindb1982.hubpages.com/hub/Lifes-greatest-secret-What-you-hold-within-is-what-you-get.

 After Swami said all that, I decided to seek clarifications for my doubts. Here is the video of the question asked and Swami's answer to the same.

Swami concluded by saying that it was foolish to consider some special things and people as God because everything is God. After a few moments of silence, I asked Swami,

"Swami, if I consider myself as God, is that not ahamkara ego?"

"No. That is not ego at all. That is the correct Truth..... But, if you simply call yourself God and do all mad things, that is not right..."

Everyone laughed at this point and Swami too laughed. It was so sweet. Swami then lovingly patted me on my head and cheek. Then He said,

"Think 'I am God' because God is the resident in me. Before you do anything enquire, 'Will God do like this? Chee ... No... But I am doing it!' Search yourself with this Truth. That is the correct way. Whatever work you are doing, do not compartmentalize it like 'worldly work, 'house work', office work' and so on. Office and home are not separate. Everything is one. Who you are is most important. When you realize that, where will the distinction between anything (office and home) remain? Wherever you see, it is only you - nothing else exists (for everything is God and you are also God). Forget everything else and enquire into this "I". That is Oneness."

There were no questions to be asked after that. 

The article "Inconvenient Truth" is all about this and is at the link below:

http://aravindb1982.blogspot.in/2015/06/the-inconvenient-truth-are-we-ready-to-live-by-it.html

iMrRoEDi2jw.title: Karmanye Vadhikaraste_Actions and Results as taught by Sai
iMrRoEDi2jw.description:
Being part of the Sri Sathya Sai Seva Organizations is like taking part in the Olympics! There are similarities galore. But the question to ponder about is whether we are athletes or the audience? 

There is also one BIG difference between being part of the Olympics and being part of Swami's Organisation - the way we are evaluated. God always judges us based on the efforts we put in and not the results we produce. 

This fascinating and unique aspect of God is delved into in this talk with analogies and anecdotes. 

This is a talk that was delivered 'virtually' for a pre-world-conference workshop of the Sri Sathya Sai Organisation in Dubai on the 23rd of January, 2015.

-TiFFKQtOEg.title: Aravind Balasubramanya - Speech at Sundaram during District Conference - Achieving Sathya Sai
-TiFFKQtOEg.description:
TOPIC: "Achieving Sathya Sai through the Organization"

Why should one have a goal in life? What should be the goal? And where does God figure in all this? The answers are powerful and emotional no doubt, but are definitely scientific and based on observations. 

The talk then moves on to what it means to 'achieve Sathya Sai' or own's personal God. As our heart and vision expands to accommodate what God truly is, we will get inspired and invigorated in this divine romance. 

Of course, the talk is peppered and spiced with experiences - personal ones of the speaker and of others!

oo_YDmoRgCk.title: Sri Sathya Sai Baba on "mediums" who claim Swami speaks/acts through them
oo_YDmoRgCk.description:
Discourse delivered on 21st November, 1988 to members of the Sri Sathya Sai Seva Organizations. The direct translation of the discourse is given below.

"Without having connections of any other sort, members of the Sathya Sai Organisation should be related only through Divine Love - heart to heart. There should be no room for money or power to dictate terms in the Organisation. I do not need temples to be built. I don't need residences. We need not even do yajnas and other rites. Our work should be our (worship) yajna. Our seva should be our rites. So, from now on at least, we should give up this bad quality of trying to collect money for the Organisation in the name of yajnas, worship, construction of temples and other rites. (Applause)

I have told this over and over again - we should not have anything to do with money; it should be with virtues. But even people who occupy positions in the organisation are developing this desire for money.

There are some people - they misuse Swami's name by saying that Swami entered them, Swami communicates through them and that He has bestowed powers on them - and use that to collect money. There can not be anything more diabolical (rakshasa-like) than this. (Applause)

Swami never enters into such things. I have never done anything like this. But misusing Swami's name like this and entering the crooked path, people are bringing a bad name to Sai. They are converting this into a field of business. But what is the kind of business you should carry out - giving and receiving love. How many ever times I may tell, there are still people who are collecting money in the name of this or that work in the Organisation."
